USC G722.1 codec

Overview
USC Codec description
 

Overview

The USC G722.1 speech codec is compliant with ITU-T G.722.1 specification for Coding at 24 and 32 kbit/s for Hands-Free operation in Systems with low frame loss promoted by International Telecommunication Union ( www.itu.org ) in part describes 7KHz audio coding for 16KHz sampling rate and has been implemented using the Intel ® Integrated Performance Primitives (Intel ® IPP) Speech Coding functions.  The USC G722 codec supports 16bit wideband 16000 Hz PCM signal compression and decompression with 20ms frame length at 16, 24 and 32 kbps producing 320, 480 and 640 bits per frame (bpf) respectively.

14KHz audio coding for 32 KHz sampling rate is not yet supported.

Additional information on this software as well as other Intel ® Software Development Products is available at http://developer.intel.com/software/products/ .

USC Codec description

For USC Interface description refer to USC manual. 

 

USC G722.1 codec parameters:

  • Codec name: IPP_G722.1

  • Compression algorithm: Modulated linear transform (MLT) based coding

  • Linkage: USC_G722_Fxns

  • Sampling: 16bit linear 16000 Hz  and 32000 Hz

  • Frame: 20ms

  • Bitrates: 16000 bps (320 bpf), 24000 bps (480 bpf) and 32000 bps (640 bpf)

  • Voice Activity Detection: VAD not supported

  • Packet Loss Concealment: PLC not supported

  • Frame types (value): Good (0), Bad (1)

  • Standard: ITU-T G.722.1, Annex C
